title: Duplicate `E0121` errors are emitted for placeholder types `_` in some positions

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-inconsistent
labels.description: Inconsistency in formatting, grammar or style between diagnostic messages

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
```rust
type FOO = fn()  -> _;

fn main() {}
```
produces ([playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=154b17548997e90ab90d0645515a9dbc)):
```
error[E0121]: the type placeholder `_` is not allowed within types on item signatures
 --> src/main.rs:1:21
  |
1 | type FOO = fn()  -> _;
  |                     ^
  |                     |
  |                     not allowed in type signatures
  |                     help: use type parameters instead: `T`

error[E0121]: the type placeholder `_` is not allowed within types on item signatures
 --> src/main.rs:1:21
  |
1 | type FOO = fn()  -> _;
  |                     ^ not allowed in type signatures

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```
